name: HD 202206
scenarioDescription:
The HD 202206 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 202206 is a star with 1.27 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.03 times its radius. It is located 150.13 light years away from the solar system.

HD 202206 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 202206 system


HD 202206 c

HD 202206 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.41 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 202206 c is 5692.2 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 202206 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 202206, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
